channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: MoCha-Stereo: Motif Channel Attention Network for Stereo Matching
item.description: In addition, edge variations in %potential feature channels of the reconstruction error map also affect details matching, we propose the Reconstruction Error Motif Penalty (REMP) module to further refine the full-resolution disparity estimation.

item.title: InstantMesh: Efficient 3D Mesh Generation from a Single Image with Sparse-view Large Reconstruction Models
item.description: We present InstantMesh, a feed-forward framework for instant 3D mesh generation from a single image, featuring state-of-the-art generation quality and significant training scalability.

item.title: NFARec: A Negative Feedback-Aware Recommender Model
item.description: In this paper, we propose a negative feedback-aware recommender model (NFARec) that maximizes the leverage of negative feedback.

item.title: Bayesian NeRF: Quantifying Uncertainty with Volume Density in Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: We present the Bayesian Neural Radiance Field (NeRF), which explicitly quantifies uncertainty in geometric volume structures without the need for additional networks, making it adept for challenging observations and uncontrolled images.

item.title: SafeGen: Mitigating Unsafe Content Generation in Text-to-Image Models
item.description: The key idea is to eliminate unsafe visual representations from the model regardless of the text input.

item.title: Multi-Agent Soft Actor-Critic with Global Loss for Autonomous Mobility-on-Demand Fleet Control
item.description: We study a sequential decision-making problem for a profit-maximizing operator of an Autonomous Mobility-on-Demand system.

item.title: Control-DAG: Constrained Decoding for Non-Autoregressive Directed Acyclic T5 using Weighted Finite State Automata
item.description: The Directed Acyclic Transformer is a fast non-autoregressive (NAR) model that performs well in Neural Machine Translation.

item.title: Transferable and Efficient Non-Factual Content Detection via Probe Training with Offline Consistency Checking
item.description: Detecting non-factual content is a longstanding goal to increase the trustworthiness of large language models (LLMs) generations.

item.title: Implicit Multi-Spectral Transformer: An Lightweight and Effective Visible to Infrared Image Translation Model
item.description: Initially, the Texture Mapping Module and Color Perception Adapter collaborate to extract texture and color features from the visible light image.

item.title: Diffusion-based inpainting of incomplete Euclidean distance matrices of trajectories generated by a fractional Brownian motion
item.description: Fractional Brownian trajectories (fBm) feature both randomness and strong scale-free correlations, challenging generative models to reproduce the intrinsic memory characterizing the underlying process.

item.title: Not All Contexts Are Equal: Teaching LLMs Credibility-aware Generation
item.description: In this paper, we propose Credibility-aware Generation (CAG), a universally applicable framework designed to mitigate the impact of flawed information in RAG.

item.title: CaDRec: Contextualized and Debiased Recommender Model
item.description: To tackle the skewed distribution, we propose two strategies for disentangling interactions: (1) modeling individual biases to learn unbiased item embeddings, and (2) incorporating item popularity with positional encoding.

item.title: XNLIeu: a dataset for cross-lingual NLI in Basque
item.description: We have conducted a series of experiments using mono- and multilingual LLMs to assess a) the effect of professional post-edition on the MT system; b) the best cross-lingual strategy for NLI in Basque; and c) whether the choice of the best cross-lingual strategy is influenced by the fact that the dataset is built by translation.

item.title: GoEX: Perspectives and Designs Towards a Runtime for Autonomous LLM Applications
item.description: We believe this is critical to unlock the potential for LLM agents to interact with applications and services with limited (post-facto) human involvement.

item.title: Meta4XNLI: A Crosslingual Parallel Corpus for Metaphor Detection and Interpretation
item.description: Metaphors, although occasionally unperceived, are ubiquitous in our everyday language.

item.title: A Gauss-Newton Approach for Min-Max Optimization in Generative Adversarial Networks
item.description: It modifies the Gauss-Newton method to approximate the min-max Hessian and uses the Sherman-Morrison inversion formula to calculate the inverse.

item.title: Simpler becomes Harder: Do LLMs Exhibit a Coherent Behavior on Simplified Corpora?
item.description: Text simplification seeks to improve readability while retaining the original content and meaning.

item.title: Quiver Laplacians and Feature Selection
item.description: The challenge of selecting the most relevant features of a given dataset arises ubiquitously in data analysis and dimensionality reduction.

item.title: Efficient and Generic Point Model for Lossless Point Cloud Attribute Compression
item.description: In this paper, we propose PoLoPCAC, an efficient and generic lossless PCAC method that achieves high compression efficiency and strong generalizability simultaneously.

item.title: VLLMs Provide Better Context for Emotion Understanding Through Common Sense Reasoning
item.description: In the first stage, we propose prompting VLLMs to generate descriptions in natural language of the subject's apparent emotion relative to the visual context.

item.title: Knowledge graphs for empirical concept retrieval
item.description: Concept-based explainable AI is promising as a tool to improve the understanding of complex models at the premises of a given user, viz.\ as a tool for personalized explainability.

item.title: Deep Generative Data Assimilation in Multimodal Setting
item.description: To our knowledge, our work is the first to apply deep generative framework for multimodal data assimilation using real-world datasets; an important step for building robust computational simulators, including the next-generation Earth system models.

item.title: VN-EGNN: E(3)-Equivariant Graph Neural Networks with Virtual Nodes Enhance Protein Binding Site Identification
item.description: However, the performance of GNNs at binding site identification is still limited potentially due to the lack of dedicated nodes that model hidden geometric entities, such as binding pockets.

item.title: Private Wasserstein Distance with Random Noises
item.description: Wasserstein distance is a principle measure of data divergence from a distributional standpoint.

item.title: TrajPRed: Trajectory Prediction with Region-based Relation Learning
item.description: We integrate multi-goal estimation and region-based relation learning to model the two stimuli, social interactions, and stochastic goals, in a prediction framework.

item.title: Exploring Concept Depth: How Large Language Models Acquire Knowledge at Different Layers?
item.description: We employ a probing technique to extract representations from different layers of the model and apply these to classification tasks.

item.title: Enhancing Safety in Mixed Traffic: Learning-Based Modeling and Efficient Control of Autonomous and Human-Driven Vehicles
item.description: By incorporating a sparse GP technique in HV modeling and adopting a dynamic GP prediction within the MPC framework, we significantly reduced the computation time of GP-MPC, marking it only 4. 6% higher than that of the conventional MPC.

item.title: Scaling Multi-Camera 3D Object Detection through Weak-to-Strong Eliciting
item.description: Finally, for MC3D-Det joint training, the elaborate dataset merge strategy is designed to solve the problem of inconsistent camera numbers and camera parameters.

item.title: Rethinking Out-of-Distribution Detection for Reinforcement Learning: Advancing Methods for Evaluation and Detection
item.description: In this paper, we study the problem of out-of-distribution (OOD) detection in RL, which focuses on identifying situations at test time that RL agents have not encountered in their training environments.

item.title: Scaling Laws for Data Filtering -- Data Curation cannot be Compute Agnostic
item.description: Vision-language models (VLMs) are trained for thousands of GPU hours on carefully curated web datasets.

item.title: ai-research
item.description: None

item.title: Ada-LEval: Evaluating long-context LLMs with length-adaptable benchmarks
item.description: Recently, the large language model (LLM) community has shown increasing interest in enhancing LLMs' capability to handle extremely long documents.

item.title: FLEX: FLEXible Federated Learning Framework
item.description: In the realm of Artificial Intelligence (AI), the need for privacy and security in data processing has become paramount.

item.title: LRR: Language-Driven Resamplable Continuous Representation against Adversarial Tracking Attacks
item.description: To achieve high accuracy on both clean and adversarial data, we propose building a spatial-temporal continuous representation using the semantic text guidance of the object of interest.

item.title: Efficient and Robust Point Cloud Registration via Heuristics-guided Parameter Search
item.description: Our strategy largely reduces the search space and can guarantee accuracy with only a few inlier samples, therefore enjoying an excellent trade-off between efficiency and robustness.

item.title: Neural networks can be FLOP-efficient integrators of 1D oscillatory integrands
item.description: We train a feed-forward neural network to compute integrals of highly oscillatory 1D functions.

item.title: On the Effect of (Near) Duplicate Subwords in Language Modelling
item.description: In this paper, we study the impact of near duplicate subwords on LM training efficiency.

item.title: ColorMNet: A Memory-based Deep Spatial-Temporal Feature Propagation Network for Video Colorization
item.description: To explore this property for better spatial and temporal feature utilization, we develop a local attention module to aggregate the features from adjacent frames in a spatial-temporal neighborhood.

item.title: Policy-Guided Diffusion
item.description: Our approach provides an effective alternative to autoregressive offline world models, opening the door to the controllable generation of synthetic training data.

item.title: PURE: Turning Polysemantic Neurons Into Pure Features by Identifying Relevant Circuits
item.description: The field of mechanistic interpretability aims to study the role of individual neurons in Deep Neural Networks.

item.title: scRDiT: Generating single-cell RNA-seq data by diffusion transformers and accelerating sampling
item.description: The method is a neural network constructed based on Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DDPMs) and Diffusion Transformers (DiTs).

item.title: CLIP-Embed-KD: Computationally Efficient Knowledge Distillation Using Embeddings as Teachers
item.description: Contrastive Language-Image Pre-training (CLIP) has been shown to improve zero-shot generalization capabilities of language and vision models.

item.title: pfl-research: simulation framework for accelerating research in Private Federated Learning
item.description: Federated learning (FL) is an emerging machine learning (ML) training paradigm where clients own their data and collaborate to train a global model, without revealing any data to the server and other participants.

item.title: Event-enhanced Retrieval in Real-time Search
item.description: Furthermore, to strengthen the focus on critical event information in events, we include a decoder module after the document encoder, introduce a generative event triplet extraction scheme based on prompt-tuning, and correlate the events with query encoder optimization through comparative learning.

item.title: Audio-Visual Generalized Zero-Shot Learning using Pre-Trained Large Multi-Modal Models
item.description: However, existing benchmarks predate the popularization of large multi-modal models, such as CLIP and CLAP.

item.title: GO4Align: Group Optimization for Multi-Task Alignment
item.description: This paper proposes \textit{GO4Align}, a multi-task optimization approach that tackles task imbalance by explicitly aligning the optimization across tasks.

item.title: Variational Stochastic Gradient Descent for Deep Neural Networks
item.description: We model gradient updates as a probabilistic model and utilize stochastic variational inference (SVI) to derive an efficient and effective update rule.

item.title: RoadBEV: Road Surface Reconstruction in Bird's Eye View
item.description: This paper uniformly proposes two simple yet effective models for road elevation reconstruction in BEV named RoadBEV-mono and RoadBEV-stereo, which estimate road elevation with monocular and stereo images, respectively.

item.title: ActNetFormer: Transformer-ResNet Hybrid Method for Semi-Supervised Action Recognition in Videos
item.description: Our framework leverages both labeled and unlabelled data to robustly learn action representations in videos, combining pseudo-labeling with contrastive learning for effective learning from both types of samples.

item.title: Leveraging Interesting Facts to Enhance User Engagement with Conversational Interfaces
item.description: Conversational Task Assistants (CTAs) guide users in performing a multitude of activities, such as making recipes.
